page.title: 20PLANTS IN BURRA
page.content: THE VEGETATION IN BURRA IS MOSTLY MOORLAND AND GRASSLAND. THERE ARE VERY FEW TREES AND THEY DON'T GROW VERY HIGH BECAUSE OF THE HIGH WINDS AND LACK OF SHELTER. THEY ALSO HAVE TO BE PROTECTED FROM THE SHEEP. MOST OF THE PLANTS IN BURRA GROW NEAR THE GROUND, LIKE DAISIES, BIRD'S FOOT TREFOIL,WILD THYME AND LADIES SMOCK. ON MARSHY GROUND ARE FOUND IRIS, SUNDEW, KING CUP AND MARSH VIOLET. THE SUNDEW TRAPS INSECTS BY OPENING STICKY SPIKES. THE MOST COMMON PLANT ON THE ROCKY SHORES ARE THRIFT OR SEA PINK. THEY SURVIVE IN PLACES WHERE NOTHING ELSE CAN LIVE. MANY OF THE PLANTS THAT GROW BEST IN SHETLAND ARE ALPINE PLANTS THAT LIKE THE CLIMATE.
